line_2: From winds that bellow, and from seas that roar?

line_2: O! art thou safe on Britain's happy shore,

line_1: And has my prince — (Oh, more than mortal pain!)
line_2: Betray'd by ruffians, felt the captive's chain?

line_1: Betray'd by ruffians, felt the captive's chain?
line_2: And has my prince — (Oh, more than mortal pain!)

line_1: Bound were those limbs, ordain'd alone to prove
line_2: The toils of empire, and the sweets of love?

line_1: The toils of empire, and the sweets of love?
line_2: Bound were those limbs, ordain'd alone to prove

line_1: Hold, hold! Barbarians of the fiercest kind!
line_2: Fear Heaven's red lightning — 'tis a prince ye bind;

line_1: Fear Heaven's red lightning — 'tis a prince ye bind;
line_2: Hold, hold! Barbarians of the fiercest kind!

line_1: A prince, whom no indignities could hide,
line_2: They knew, presumptuous! and the gods defied.

line_1: They knew, presumptuous! and the gods defied.
line_2: A prince, whom no indignities could hide,

line_1: Where-e'er he moves, let love-join'd reverence rise,
line_2: And all mankind behold with Zara's eyes!

line_1: And all mankind behold with Zara's eyes!
line_2: Where-e'er he moves, let love-join'd reverence rise,

line_1: Thy breast alone, when bounding o'er the waves
line_2: To Freedom's climes, from slavery and slaves;

line_1: To Freedom's climes, from slavery and slaves;
line_2: Thy breast alone, when bounding o'er the waves

line_1: Thy breast alone the pleasing thought could frame
line_2: Of what I felt, when thy dear letters came:

line_1: Of what I felt, when thy dear letters came:
line_2: Thy breast alone the pleasing thought could frame

line_1: A thousand times I held them to my breast,
line_2: A thousand times my lips the paper prest:

line_1: A thousand times my lips the paper prest:
line_2: A thousand times I held them to my breast,

line_1: My full heart panted with a joy too strong,
line_2: And "Oh, my prince!" died faultering on my tongue:

line_1: And "Oh, my prince!" died faultering on my tongue:
line_2: My full heart panted with a joy too strong,

line_1: Fainting I sunk, unequal to the strife,
line_2: And milder joys sustain'd returning life.

line_1: And milder joys sustain'd returning life.
line_2: Fainting I sunk, unequal to the strife,

line_1: Hope, sweet enchantress, round my love-sick head
line_2: Delightful scenes of blest delusion spread.

line_1: Delightful scenes of blest delusion spread.
line_2: Hope, sweet enchantress, round my love-sick head

line_1: "Come, come, my prince! my charmer! haste away;
line_2: " Come, come, I cried, thy Zara blames thy stay.

line_1: " Come, come, I cried, thy Zara blames thy stay.
line_2: "Come, come, my prince! my charmer! haste away;

line_1: "For thee, the shrubs their richest sweets retain;
line_2: " For thee, new colours wait to paint the plain;

line_1: " For thee, new colours wait to paint the plain;
line_2: "For thee, the shrubs their richest sweets retain;

line_1: "For thee, cool breezes linger in the grove,
line_2: " The birds expect thee in the green alcove;

line_1: " The birds expect thee in the green alcove;
line_2: "For thee, cool breezes linger in the grove,

line_1: "Till thy return, the rills sorget to fall,
line_2: " Till thy return, the sun, the soul of all! —

line_1: " Till thy return, the sun, the soul of all! —
line_2: "Till thy return, the rills sorget to fall,

line_1: "He comes, my maids, in his meridian charms,
line_2: " He comes refulgent to his Zara's arms:

line_1: " He comes refulgent to his Zara's arms:
line_2: "He comes, my maids, in his meridian charms,

line_1: "With jocund songs proclaim my love's return;
line_2: " With jocund hearts his nuptial bed adorn.

line_1: " With jocund hearts his nuptial bed adorn.
line_2: "With jocund songs proclaim my love's return;

line_1: "Bright as the sun, yet gentle as the dove,
line_2: " He comes, uniting majesty and love.  "—

line_1: " He comes, uniting majesty and love.  "—
line_2: "Bright as the sun, yet gentle as the dove,

line_1: Too soon, alas! the blest delusion flies;
line_2: Care swells my breast, and sorrow fills my eyes.

line_1: Care swells my breast, and sorrow fills my eyes.
line_2: Too soon, alas! the blest delusion flies;

line_1: Ah! why do thy fond words suggest a fear —
line_2: Too vast, too numerous, those already here!

line_1: Too vast, too numerous, those already here!
line_2: Ah! why do thy fond words suggest a fear —

line_1: Ah! why with doubts torment my bleeding breast,
line_2: Of seas which storms controul, and foes insest!

line_1: Of seas which storms controul, and foes insest!
line_2: Ah! why with doubts torment my bleeding breast,

line_1: My heart, in all this tedious absence, knows
line_2: No thoughts but those of seas, and storms, and foes.

line_1: No thoughts but those of seas, and storms, and foes.
line_2: My heart, in all this tedious absence, knows

line_1: Each joyless morning, with the rising sun,
line_2: Quick to the strand my feet spontaneous run:

line_1: Quick to the strand my feet spontaneous run:
line_2: Each joyless morning, with the rising sun,

line_1: "Where, where's my prince! what tidings have ye brought!"
line_2: Of each I met, with pleading tears I sought.

line_1: Of each I met, with pleading tears I sought.
line_2: "Where, where's my prince! what tidings have ye brought!"

line_1: In vain I sought, some, conscious of my pain,
line_2: With horrid silence pointed to the main.

line_1: With horrid silence pointed to the main.
line_2: In vain I sought, some, conscious of my pain,

line_1: Some with a sneer the brutal thought exprest,
line_2: And plung'd the dagger of a barbarous jest.

line_1: And plung'd the dagger of a barbarous jest.
line_2: Some with a sneer the brutal thought exprest,

line_1: Day follow'd day, and still I wish'd the next,
line_2: New hopes still flatter'd, and new doubts perplex'd;

line_1: New hopes still flatter'd, and new doubts perplex'd;
line_2: Day follow'd day, and still I wish'd the next,

line_1: Day follow'd day, the wish'd to-morrow came,
line_2: My hopes, doubts, fears, anxieties the same.

line_1: My hopes, doubts, fears, anxieties the same.
line_2: Day follow'd day, the wish'd to-morrow came,

line_1: At length — "O Power Supreme! whoe'er thou art,
line_2: " Thy shrine the sky, the sea, the earth, or heart;

line_1: " Thy shrine the sky, the sea, the earth, or heart;
line_2: At length — "O Power Supreme! whoe'er thou art,

line_1: "Since every clime, and all th' unbounded main,
line_2: " And hostile barks, and storms, are thy domain,

line_1: " And hostile barks, and storms, are thy domain,
line_2: "Since every clime, and all th' unbounded main,

line_1: "If faithful passion can thy bounty move,
line_2: " And goodness sure must be the friend of love,

line_1: " And goodness sure must be the friend of love,
line_2: "If faithful passion can thy bounty move,

line_1: "Safe to these arms my lovely prince restore,
line_2: " Safe to his Zara's arms, to part no more.

line_1: " Safe to his Zara's arms, to part no more.
line_2: "Safe to these arms my lovely prince restore,

line_1: "O! grant to virtue thy protecting care,
line_2: " And grant thy love to love's availing prayer,

line_1: " And grant thy love to love's availing prayer,
line_2: "O! grant to virtue thy protecting care,

line_1: "Together then, and emulous to praise,
line_2: " A flowery altar to thy name we'll raise;

line_1: " A flowery altar to thy name we'll raise;
line_2: "Together then, and emulous to praise,

line_1: "There, first and last, on each returning day,
line_2: " To thee our vows of gratitude we'll pay. "

line_1: " To thee our vows of gratitude we'll pay. "
line_2: "There, first and last, on each returning day,

line_1: Fool that I was, to all my comfort blind,
line_2: Why, when thou went'st, did Zara stay behind?

line_1: Why, when thou went'st, did Zara stay behind?
line_2: Fool that I was, to all my comfort blind,

line_1: How could I fondly hope one joy to prove,
line_2: 'Midst all the wild anxieties of love?

line_1: 'Midst all the wild anxieties of love?
line_2: How could I fondly hope one joy to prove,

line_1: Had fate in other mold, thy Zara form'd,
line_2: And my bold breast in manly friendship warm'd,

line_1: And my bold breast in manly friendship warm'd,
line_2: Had fate in other mold, thy Zara form'd,

line_1: How had I glow'd exulting at thy side!
line_2: How all the shafts of adverse fate defied!

line_1: How all the shafts of adverse fate defied!
line_2: How had I glow'd exulting at thy side!

line_1: Or yet a woman, and not nerv'd for toil,
line_2: With thee, O! had I turn'd a burning soil!

line_1: With thee, O! had I turn'd a burning soil!
line_2: Or yet a woman, and not nerv'd for toil,

line_1: In the cold prison had I lain with thee,
line_2: In love still happy, we had still been free;

line_1: In love still happy, we had still been free;
line_2: In the cold prison had I lain with thee,

line_1: Then fortune brav'd, had own'd superior might,
line_2: And pin'd with envy, while we forc'd delight.

line_1: And pin'd with envy, while we forc'd delight.
line_2: Then fortune brav'd, had own'd superior might,

line_1: Why shouldst thou bid thy love remember thee?
line_2: Thine all my thoughts have been, and still shall be.

line_1: Thine all my thoughts have been, and still shall be.
line_2: Why shouldst thou bid thy love remember thee?

line_1: Each night the cool Savannahs have I sought,
line_2: And breath'd the fondness of enamour'd thought;

line_1: And breath'd the fondness of enamour'd thought;
line_2: Each night the cool Savannahs have I sought,

line_1: The curling breezes murmur'd as I sigh'd,
line_2: And hoarse, at distance, roar'd my soe the tide:

line_1: And hoarse, at distance, roar'd my soe the tide:
line_2: The curling breezes murmur'd as I sigh'd,

line_1: My breast still haunted by a motly train,
line_2: Now doubts, now hopes prevail'd, now joy, now pain,

line_1: Now doubts, now hopes prevail'd, now joy, now pain,
line_2: My breast still haunted by a motly train,

line_1: Now fix'd I stand, my spirit fled to thine,
line_2: Nor note the time, nor see the sun decline;

line_1: Nor note the time, nor see the sun decline;
line_2: Now fix'd I stand, my spirit fled to thine,

line_1: Now rouz'd I start, and wing'd with fear I run,
line_2: In vain, alas! for 'tis myself I shun.

line_1: In vain, alas! for 'tis myself I shun.
line_2: Now rouz'd I start, and wing'd with fear I run,

line_1: When kindly sleep its lenient balm supplied,
line_2: And gave that comfort waking thought denied.

line_1: And gave that comfort waking thought denied.
line_2: When kindly sleep its lenient balm supplied,

line_1: Last night — but why, ah Zara! why impart,
line_2: The fond, fond fancies of a love-sick heart?

line_1: The fond, fond fancies of a love-sick heart?
line_2: Last night — but why, ah Zara! why impart,

line_1: Yet true delights on fancy's wings are brought,
line_2: And love's soft raptures realiz'd in thought —

line_1: And love's soft raptures realiz'd in thought —
line_2: Yet true delights on fancy's wings are brought,

line_1: Last night I saw, methinks I see it now —
line_2: Heaven's awful concave round thy Zara bow;

line_1: Heaven's awful concave round thy Zara bow;
line_2: Last night I saw, methinks I see it now —

line_1: When sudden thence a flaming chariot flew,
line_2: Which earth receiv'd, and six white coursers drew.

line_1: Which earth receiv'd, and six white coursers drew.
line_2: When sudden thence a flaming chariot flew,

line_1: Then — quick transition — did thy Zara ride,
line_2: Borne to the chariot — wonderous — by thy side:

line_1: Borne to the chariot — wonderous — by thy side:
line_2: Then — quick transition — did thy Zara ride,

line_1: All glorious both, from clime to clime we flew,
line_2: Each happy clime with sweet surprize we view.

line_1: Each happy clime with sweet surprize we view.
line_2: All glorious both, from clime to clime we flew,

line_1: A thousand voices sung — "All bliss betide
line_2: " The prince of Lybia, and his faithful bride. "

line_1: " The prince of Lybia, and his faithful bride. "
line_2: A thousand voices sung — "All bliss betide

line_1: " 'Tis done, 'tis done, "resounded thro' the skies.
line_2: And quick aloft the car began to rise;

line_1: And quick aloft the car began to rise;
line_2: " 'Tis done, 'tis done, "resounded thro' the skies.

line_1: Ten thousand beauties crowded on my sight,
line_2: Ten thousand glories beam'd a dazzling light.

line_1: Ten thousand glories beam'd a dazzling light.
line_2: Ten thousand beauties crowded on my sight,

line_1: My thoughts could bear no more, the vision fled,
line_2: And wretched Zara view'd her lonely bed. —

line_1: And wretched Zara view'd her lonely bed. —
line_2: My thoughts could bear no more, the vision fled,

line_1: Come, sweet interpreter, and ease my soul;
line_2: Come to my bosom, and explain the whole.

line_1: Come to my bosom, and explain the whole.
line_2: Come, sweet interpreter, and ease my soul;

line_1: Alas! my prince — yet hold, my struggling breast!
line_2: Sure we shall meet again, again be blest.

line_1: Sure we shall meet again, again be blest.
line_2: Alas! my prince — yet hold, my struggling breast!

line_1: " Hope all, thou say'st, I live, and still am free; "
line_2: O! then prevent those hopes, and haste to me.

line_1: O! then prevent those hopes, and haste to me.
line_2: " Hope all, thou say'st, I live, and still am free; "

line_1: Ease all the doubts thy Zara's bosom knows,
line_2: And kindly stop the torrent of her woes.

line_1: And kindly stop the torrent of her woes.
line_2: Ease all the doubts thy Zara's bosom knows,

line_1: But, that I know too well thy generous heart,
line_2: One doubt, than all, more torment would impart:

line_1: One doubt, than all, more torment would impart:
line_2: But, that I know too well thy generous heart,

line_1: 'Tis this, in Britain's happy courts to shine,
line_2: Amidst a thousand blooming maids, is thine —

line_1: Amidst a thousand blooming maids, is thine —
line_2: 'Tis this, in Britain's happy courts to shine,

line_1: But thou, a thousand blooming maids among,
line_2: Art still thyself, incapable of wrong;

line_1: Art still thyself, incapable of wrong;
line_2: But thou, a thousand blooming maids among,

line_1: No outward charm can captivate thy mind,
line_2: Thy love is friendship heighten'd and refin'd;

line_1: Thy love is friendship heighten'd and refin'd;
line_2: No outward charm can captivate thy mind,

line_1: 'Tis what my soul, and not my form inspires,
line_2: And burns with spotless and immortal fires.

line_1: And burns with spotless and immortal fires.
line_2: 'Tis what my soul, and not my form inspires,

line_1: Thy joys, like mine, from conscious truth arise,
line_2: And, known these joys, what others canst thou prize?

line_1: And, known these joys, what others canst thou prize?
line_2: Thy joys, like mine, from conscious truth arise,

line_1: Be jealous doubts the curse of sordid minds;
line_2: Hence, jealous doubts, I give ye to the winds. —

line_1: Hence, jealous doubts, I give ye to the winds. —
line_2: Be jealous doubts the curse of sordid minds;

line_1: Once more, O come! and snatch me to thy arms!
line_2: Come, shield my beating heart from vain alarms!

line_1: Come, shield my beating heart from vain alarms!
line_2: Once more, O come! and snatch me to thy arms!

line_1: Come, let me hang enamour'd on thy breast,
line_2: Weep pleasing tears, and be with joy distrest!

line_1: Weep pleasing tears, and be with joy distrest!
line_2: Come, let me hang enamour'd on thy breast,

line_1: Let me still hear, and still demand thy tale,
line_2: And, oft renew'd, still let my suit prevail!

line_1: And, oft renew'd, still let my suit prevail!
line_2: Let me still hear, and still demand thy tale,

line_1: Much still remains to tell and to enquire,
line_2: My hand still writes, and writing prompts desire;

line_1: My hand still writes, and writing prompts desire;
line_2: Much still remains to tell and to enquire,

line_1: My pen denies my last farewell to write,
line_2: Still, still, "return," my wishful thoughts indite:

line_1: Still, still, "return," my wishful thoughts indite:
line_2: My pen denies my last farewell to write,

line_1: O! hear, my prince, thy love, thy mistress call,
line_2: Think o'er each tender name, and hear by all.

line_1: Think o'er each tender name, and hear by all.
line_2: O! hear, my prince, thy love, thy mistress call,

line_1: O! pleasing intercourse of soul with soul,
line_2: Thus, while I write, I see, I clasp thee whole;

line_1: Thus, while I write, I see, I clasp thee whole;
line_2: O! pleasing intercourse of soul with soul,

line_1: And these kind letters trembling Zara drew,
line_2: In every line shall bring her to thy view.

line_1: In every line shall bring her to thy view.
line_2: And these kind letters trembling Zara drew,

line_1: Return, return, in love and truth excell;
line_2: Return, I write; I cannot add — Farewell.

line_1: Return, I write; I cannot add — Farewell.
line_2: Return, return, in love and truth excell;
